questions.text: Which data type is used in this study?
Which type of digital health application is considered in this study?
choices: Precision Medicine: technology that uses individual-level biological information to generate care insights
Health IT: technology that records, stores, protects, and/or retrieves clinical, administrative, or financial patient information
Digital Medicine: technology that support the practice of medicine, e.g. for measurement, tools for treatment, recovery, prevention, and health promotion
Telehealth: technology that enables care delivery without patient and care deliverer being at the same physical location
Wellness: technology that tracks and/or provides insights on personal fitness and wellbeing

questions.text: To which ICD-10 code group does the digital health application in this study pertain?
choices: D50-D89: Diseases of the blood and blood-forming organs and certain disorders involving the immune mechanism
E00-E90: Endocrine, nutritional and metabolic diseases
G00-G99: Diseases of the nervous system
H00-H59: Diseases of the eye and adnexa
H60-H95: Diseases of the ear and mastoid process
I00-I99: Diseases of the circulatory system
J00-J99: Diseases of the respiratory system
K00-K93: Diseases of the digestive system
L00-L99: Diseases of the skin and subcutaneous tissue
M00-M99: Diseases of the musculoskeletal system and connective tissue
N00-N99: Diseases of the genitourinary system
O00-O99: Pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium
P00-P96: Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period
Q00-Q99: Congenital malformations, deformations and chromosomal abnormalities
S00-T98: Injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes
Other: the disease or health condition does not fit any of the other categories

questions.text: Is the aim of this study prognostic or diagnostic? Pick either prognostic or diagnostic.
How many participants are included in this study?
How many observations are included in the dataset which is input to the prediction model?
What was the procedure for splitting the dataset into training and validation sets in this study?
choices: No splitting: there was explicitly no splitting of the dataset performed
Unknown from this paper: choose this if no mention of splitting the dataset

questions.text: How is missing data handled in this study?
choices: Irrelevant: there was no missing data
Simple Imputation: imputation with a fixed or otherwise simplistic value such as mean, mode, or forward-fill
Model-based Imputation: estimating and imputing missing values using a model
Unknown from this paper: choose this if no mention of missing data

questions.text: How are outliers handled in this study?
choices: Irrelevant: outlier detection was performed but no outliers were found
Transformed: outliers were transformed to a different value
Robustly modelled: robust modelling approaches were used due to presence of outliers
Unknown from this paper: choose this if no mention of outliers

questions.text: Which prediction models were used in this study? Choose the best fitting category for each distinct model.
choices: Generalized Linear Model: any specific version of a generalized linear model, with or without regularization
Boosting: other than Gradient Boosted Decision Trees
Ensemble: other than Bagging, Boosting, or Stacking
Other: model fits none of the other categories

questions.text: Which prediction model came out as best-performing in this study? Choose only one.
choices: Generalized Linear Model: any specific version of a generalized linear model, with or without regularization
Boosting: other than Gradient Boosted Decision Trees
Ensemble: other than Bagging, Boosting, or Stacking
Other: model fits none of the other categories

questions.text: How were hyperparameters tuned in this study?
choices: Other: hyperparameter tuning was performed but the method fits none of the other categories
No hyperparameter tuning performed: choose this if no mention of hyperparameter tuning

questions.text: Which methods for data augmentation and/or generation were used in this study?
choices: SMOTE: or any variant of SMOTE
Generative model: a generative model was trained to generate new datapoints
Other: data augmentation or generation was performed but the method fits none of the other categories
No data augmentation or generation performed: choose this if no mention of data augmentation or generation

questions.text: Which type of statistical and/or machine learning explainability techniques are used?
choices: No explainability techniques used: choose this if no mention of explainability techniques
Model coefficients: model coefficients are directly/intrinsically interpretable
Other: explainability techniques were used but the method fits none of the other categories

questions.text: Which evaluation metrics or outcome measures are used to assess the predictive models?
choices: Error-based: includes metrics like RMSE, MSE, MAE, MAPE, etc.
Confusion matrix: also includes true/false positive rate as these can be directly derived from the confusion matrix
Other: evaluation metrics or outcome measures were used but the method fits none of the other categories
Unknown from this paper: choose this if no mention of evaluation metrics or outcome measures
